intro: Ouratea lutambensis, commonly known as the Lutambé Ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while the flowers are usually white or pale yellow. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
